items.title: European leaders rally behind Greenland amid threats of Trump takeover
items.description: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American takeover of the Danish territory in the wake of their successful Venezuela operation, saying the island is needed for national security.

items.title: Live: Trump plans to meet with US oil bosses at the White House
items.description: US President Donald Trump says he plans to meet with American oil companies. Follow live.

items.title: Trump's intervention in Venezuela is beyond comparison
items.description: The global shock caused by the Trump administration's interventions in Venezuela sent analysts scurrying for historic comparisons, but nothing really compares to what happened at the weekend.

items.title: Day-by-day guide to most severe southern Australia heatwave in years
items.description: Southern Australia will collectively bake this week through the most intense spell of heat in years as temperatures soar up to 15 degrees Celsius above the mid-summer average.

items.title: Calls for a royal commission into Bondi an untenable political distraction
items.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

items.title: Ukraine secures pledge for security guarantees from European allies
items.description: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO said they would provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

items.title: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west
items.description: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

items.title: 'High volume' response after application for QVB windows to be made clear
items.description: Dozens of people have expressed opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

items.title: A missing mother, the desolate desert and a $500k reward
items.description: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

items.title: Australians trapped on Yemeni island after flare-up between Saudis and UAE
items.description: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

items.title: Car excess insurer hit by cyber breach as 'threat actor' contacts customers
items.description: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

items.title: Live: Blue-chip strength rallies Wall Street, ASX to rise ahead of key inflation data
items.description: A strong overnight session on Wall Street is likely to support the ASX today ahead of the release of key inflation data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Remote pub at centre of Peter Falconio mystery has liquor licence suspended
items.description: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

items.title: Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory
items.description: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

items.title: Tiny school works to save extremely rare 'flying jewel' butterfly
items.description: It's the size of a 10-cent piece and matures under the guard of protective ants, but the purple copper butterfly needs more help to survive — and a group of NSW primary school students has stepped up to the challenge.

items.title: De Minaur dazzles as Australia reaches United Cup quarterfinals
items.description: Twin wins from Alex de Minaur drags Australia off the canvas and into the United Cup quarterfinals with a do-or-die victory over Czechia.

items.title: Videos made by SA librarians attract likes from Ariana Grande
items.description: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

items.title: Tributes flow for National Party stalwart after death at home
items.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

items.title: Care workers say they are powerless to stop children using ice
items.description: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

items.title: 'It wasn't your fault': Ben Austin's parents offer support for other boy involved in cricket tragedy
items.description: Ben Austin died after a cricket ball struck him in late October. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no one is to blame for the tragic accident.

items.title: Clark denies confrontation with CA boss after interview ban
items.description: Stuart Clark opens up on his conversation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg after his stinging criticism.

items.title: Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Hijikata advances
items.description: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.

items.title: The tough balance of social housing as Perth mother faces eviction
items.description: As protesters strive to keep a woman from community housing eviction, the complexities of her situation collide with a housing provider's options.

items.title: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne
items.description: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

items.title: Sinkholes could be forming for years before a sudden collapse. Here's why
items.description: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.
